snippet: People on Capitol Hill said the initial campaign for strikes against Syria proved unpersuasive, but administration officials insist the debate will continue when Congress returns from recess.
abstract: Obama administration is enlisting every senior official to improve its odds in winning support in Congress for a military strike on Syria; after a frenetic week of wall-to-wall intelligence briefings and hours of hearings, both Republicans and Democrats are lining up to vote against Pres Obama; administration officials insist debate has just begun and will continue when Congress returns from recess.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: People on Capitol Hill said the initial campaign for strikes against Syria proved unpersuasive, but administration officials insist the debate will continue when Congress returns from recess.

headline.main: Obama’s Battle for Syria Votes, Taut and Uphill
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Battle For Syria Votes, Taut and Uphill
